title: [Large-Scale] Activity-Based Learning and Reflective Processes to Address Information Systems Development (ISD) Learning Failures

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic information system development concepts
context.additional_context: Hands-on training for current professionals. Conducts smartphone-based learning in constrained technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze failure factors at each ISD project stage and propose improvement measures

Learners select 3 enterprise practical problems (inventory optimization, budget allocation, production planning), apply activity-based learning techniques (2 case studies, 1 simulation), and collaborate with 3–4 team members to design a problem-solving process (problem definition → data collection → modeling → verification → report writing). Within 4 weeks, they submit a 10-page final report (APA format) and 15-minute presentation (10–12 slides), achieving an average of 3+ points (out of 4) in the report evaluation rubric (clarity, analytical depth, practicality, collaboration effectiveness).
Learners systematically analyze learning experiences in the ISD process and develop improvement plans through reflective journaling

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
